intro: Stypandra umbellata, commonly known as the white-flowered stypandra, is a species of flowering plant native to the southern regions of Western Australia. It belongs to the family Rhamnaceae and is characterized by its erect, branching stems and clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped fruits that are typically green when mature and turn red upon ripening. It thrives in sandy soils and is often found in shrublands and coastal areas. Stypandra umbellata is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological importance in supporting local wildlife.
